dialogues.text: Did I look worried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist and Kat look out at an enormous yacht.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Sleeps 70, with crew. Four tenders, two helicopters, missile defences -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Jesus. Worried about pirates?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Andrei loves playing one government off another. The day they turn, that’s his refuge.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What if I joined you? She nods at Volkov, holding the launch’s line.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m not sure Volkov’s taking passengers just now.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Then let’s take mine. The Protagonist nods at Volkov as they walk past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist GUNS his boat hard, carving a GLITTERING across the calm harbour. Kat sits, enjoying the speed. The Protagonist pulls up alongside the yacht, CREW MEMBER SCRAMBLE, unaccustomed to unauthorized approaches. The Protagonist follows Kat's gaze to a FIGURE above, but the is behind it. Kat steps onto the yacht. The Protagonist gives the figure a JAUNTY SALUTE. No response. The Protagonist ZIPS back towards shore, passin the yacht’s launch. He waves at Volkov.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Follow Kat into the enormous lounge. She drops her bags -

dialogues.speaker: MALE VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who’s the American?  56. She turns. A middle-aged man with cold eyes and a thin be stands in the doorway. THIS IS SATOR.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: A friend.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: The man from Shipley’s?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Who you tried to have beaten up?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I ask again. Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: We met in Riyadh. In June at the American Embassy.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Good with fists for a diplomat...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Paranoia’s your department. He seems nice, I invited him to the dinner. (turns away) Max?... Max?!...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: He’s visiting Pompeii and Herculaneum.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Overnight? You just sent him off?!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: He’s my son.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Our son. I told him I’d go with him

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I explained you were busy. With your friend. He turns, walks away. She watches him leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist walks towards a table where Sator, holdin court, attacks some crabs. Volkov stops the Protagonist a FRISKS him, in full view of the diners.  57.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Where I’m from, you buy me dinner first. Without looking, Sator gestures at a seat, Volkov lets th Protagonist pass. He sits.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mr Sator? I’m -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (quiet) Don’t bother. Just tell me if you've slept with my wife, yet. The Protagonist glances up at Kat, opposite, chatting.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No. Not yet. A glance from Sator between buttery mouthfuls of crab.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: How would you like to die?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Old.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You chose the wrong profession. Sator returns a toast from a grinning guest. Reaches a gr palm to the Protagonist’s cheek, as if in friendliness...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s a walled garden up the road. We're going to take you there, cut your throat, not across, in the middle, like a hole. Then we take your balls, stuff them in the cut, block the windpipe.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Complex.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: It's gratifying to watch a man you don’t like try to pull his own balls out of his throat before he chokes.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Is this how you treat all your guests?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: The ones using my family to get to me.  58.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How else is someone supposed to get to you?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Only a fool wants to be near me.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Or someone who has something worth delaying your gratification for... Sator signals Volkov - Kat glances over as Volkov RISES -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: We're finished.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Do you like opera? At this, Sator pauses. Waves off Volkov.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Not here. You sail?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’ve messed around on boats.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Be on the dock at eight. Ready to do more than mess around. Kat, relieved, watches the Protagonist leave. EXT. DINING ROOM, YACHT —- MORNING Kat enters, dressed in sailing gear. Sator is already sea similarly dressed, reading his phone, with a cup of coffe

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Max has missed too much school this year. I’m taking him back to England.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: No, you’re not. He has a tutor here.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: The school won't be okay with -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Yes, they will.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Can I finish?!  59.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Look around you - he has everything he needs here. A SERVANT places a plate with a silver cover in front of then pours her coffee.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You don’t care what he needs. You bought the trappings of a king, but we both know you’re a grubby little man playing power games with a wife who doesn’t love him any more. Sator looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You seem spirited today.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (defiant) Do I? Sator barely nods at the servant, who pulls off the lid..

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Yes. You do. On the plate, instead of breakfast, is a small drawing. A ‘Rubens’. Kat freezes.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Were you worried it had been destroyed? Rest assured, instinct told me to remove it from the vault. I’ve always had instincts about the future. That’s how I built this life you no longer value. Kat looks up at him, not knowing what to say or do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist stands on the dock, dressed for sailing, watching the launch approach...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Morning. As he gets on, Kat ignores him. Sator enjoys this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist tries to catch Kat’s eye, but she will no look his way.  60. Sator hands the Protagonist a HARNESS and a HELMET... he looks at them, taken aback, then looks ahead - towards TW GRAPHITE DARK, HIGHEST TECH AMERICA’S CUP SAILING YACHTS, trimmed and ready.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (impressed) When you said sailing... EXT. SAILING YACHT DECK —- MOMENTS LATER Kat gets on, followed by Sator and the Protagonist. The rigging crew departs. Kat checks the sheets and winches. Sator indicates the harness.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You know how?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Aye, Captain. Sator gestures at Kat.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: She's captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boats FLY, SKIMMING THE WATER ON THEIR HYDROFOILS... Sator and the Protagonist are next to each other, standin one pontoon, LEANING OUT IN THEIR HARNESSES... Kat is at wheel, concentrating...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: What do you know about opera?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: In 2008 a remote Russian missile station was overwhelmed and held for a week. When the station was retaken, the plutonium 241 on one warhead was three quarters of a kilo lighter. The missing 241 surfaced at the opera-house siege in Kiev on the 14th.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You're well informed. But that doesn’t mean you have the plutonium.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I didn’t say I had it. I’m saying I know how to get it -  61.

dialogues.speaker: COMING ABOUT
dialogues.text: Kat SWINGS the boat into the wind, SAIL FLAPPING FURIOUSL the wind catches it on the other side, and Sator and the Protagonist DUCK under the boom, RACING to the other side their harnesses SNAPPING TAUT as they lean out...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: What do you propose?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Partnership.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I wouldn't partner with you. Kat works the wheel, tracking the other boat. Her look is of BOTTLED RAGE...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with me?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You know how to handle yourself, you have no record.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Someone in the arms trade with training who covers his tracks? Not that shocking.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: For an intelligence agent. Sator holds the Protagonist’s gaze...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Secure your jib line. The Protagonist turns - Kat leans in to Sator -

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Burn in hell, Andrei - - and YANKS HIS QUICK-RELEASE - he FLIES off the boat, SMASHING HEAD-FIRST into the waves - The Protagonist sees Sator FACE-DOWN, UNCONSCIOUS - he UNCLIPS, JUMPS to the wheel, SPINNING the boat OFF THE WI

dialogues.speaker: YOU CAN'T JIBE A BOAT LIKE THIS
dialogues.text: The Protagonist STEERS the boat across the wind, SNAPPING BOOM ACROSS, ALMOST LOSING THE MAST —  62.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You can if you have to - He RELEASES THE SHEETS, SPILLING WIND, LOSING SPEED - as pass Sator he DIVES into the water - GRABS the oligarch - PULLS his face out of the water... Sator starts COUGHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist dries himself - the door opens - Kat BURS in -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: WHY DIDN’T YOU LET HIM DROWN?! She is on him, smashing her fists into his chest -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I need him.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: To sell guns?!

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’m not who you think I am.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: That, I know - he showed me the drawing.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea what you've done?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I had to get close to him. I don’t know what you think your husband is

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: We both know he’s an arms dealer.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He’s so much more.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: What, then?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Andrei Sator holds all our lives in his hands. Not just yours. She looks bemused. A KNOCK at the door - she hides behind  63.

dialogues.speaker: VOLKOV
dialogues.text: Mr Sator wants to see you. The Protagonist nods - pushes the door - Volkov stops it

dialogues.speaker: VOLKOV, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He wants to see me without pants? Volkov lets the door shut. The Protagonist turns to Kat -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trust me.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Save it. I’m not falling for it twice. The Protagonist looks at Kat. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You have a better option? She looks into the Protagonist’s eyes. Assessing.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Whatever it takes to get what you want. Just like him. Not a second’s thought about me. My son. What do you think he’s going to do to me now? He pulls a gun from his bag. Offers it to her.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Try not to use this - She takes it - lets it point at him.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On anyone. INT. STUDY, SATOR’S YACHT - EVENING The Protagonist is shown in. Sator is sitting behind his desk. A DOCTOR is taking his blood pressure.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Enough - Sator RIPS the cuff off his arm, sending the doctor out - checks a fitness tracker on his wrist.  64.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See? Pulse of a man half my age. Drink with me. Sator pours them both tumblers of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It seems I now owe you my life.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: It’s nothing. Sator fixes his black gaze on the Protagonist.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: My life is not nothing. And I don’t like to be in debt.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Then pay me. No retribution against your wife. A dangerous beat. Then Sator GRINS -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You think she released my harness? (laughs ) It was my own mistake.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Then help me steal the 241. I need resources. It’s weapons-grade plutonium - that means special handling, containment facilities -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I know what it means. You lecture me about radiation. Andrei Sator, digging plutonium from the rubble of my city as a teenager?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Stalsk-12. My home. Sator sips his drink. Looks the Protagonist in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One pod of a warhead exploded at ground level, scattering the others. They needed people to find the plutonium...  65.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It became my first contract - nobody else even bid. They thought it was a death sentence.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But one man’s probability of death is another man’s possibility for a life...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I staked my claim in the new Russia. Even now, my company is the only one to operate in the ruins.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: The 241’s being transported through Northern Europe on its way to the long-term nuclear storage depot at Trieste. I’m told you have resources in Tallinn. Sator downs his vodka.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Stay with us tonight. I insist. INT. KAT’S STATEROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - NIGHT Kat slips the gun under her mattress, feels the lump - pu it out - moves to the desk, puts it in her jewellery case hearing a noise she jumps onto the bed, picks up a book. door opens. Sator. He locks the door.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: What do you want, Andrei?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: We're going to talk about today.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: No, we’re not.  66. He removes a DIAMOND CUFFLINK...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: No? Kat starts to get off the bed -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Don’t think for a minute you can treat me the way you treat your other women. Sator shifts to lean on the desk, cutting her off from th jewellery box. She sits back down. He removes his belt...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: And how do you imagine I treat these other women? Sator slips the cufflink through a belt hole...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You think I force them into conversation? Sator tests the diamond studded belt against his palm.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to be quiet? Fine... He tosses her a pillow.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bite down on that... Sator moves towards her - she looks at the jewellery box the desk - no way around him - Sator looks down at her. S looks up at his cold eyes...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Even a soul as blank and brittle as yours needs a response. Is fear and pain enough? Because that’s all I have to offer.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Then it’ll have to do.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you just throw me out?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: If I can’t have you, no one can.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: At what point do you give up and kill me?  67. Sator shrugs, wraps the belt a turn around his fist...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Turn over.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Touch me, I scream so loud he hears.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You think I'd let him interfere?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: If he tried you’d have to kill him. End of deal. So leave me the fuck alone. A KNOCK at the door.

dialogues.speaker: NOT NOW
dialogues.text: But he hears a RUMBLING... Sator, without a word, exits - EXT. SATOR’S YACHT, AMALFI COAST - NIGHT Sator GRABS binoculars from one of his men, peering out - A helicopter EMERGES from the darkness, THUNDERING IN... INT. GUEST STATEROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist listens to the incoming chopper - pulls o black Windbreaker - quietly opens his door... INT. PASSAGE, BELOW DECKS, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist makes his way, looking for an exit... EXT. SATOR’S YACHT, AMALFI COAST - CONTINUOUS The chopper descends to the landing pad - rotors turning Sator signals his men to head in... EXT. SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist is on a roof overlooking the helipad... He watches Sator’s men remove a LARGE, GRUBBY CAPSULE and take it below as the chopper LIFTS OFF...  68. INT. STORAGE AREA, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist makes his way through the storage area. Peering through a window, he sees - INT. ENGINE ROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Crew gathered around the capsule. Sator enters, wipes dir from the latches and opens it. Sator puts his hand over t open capsule, letting small, flat GOLD BARS leap from the capsule into his hand... he looks up, expectantly... The Crew SHOVES a CREW MEMBER forwards, onto his knees... eyes downcast, he reaches behind - pulls a gold bar from rear pocket. He offers it to Sator with TREMBLING hands. Sator takes it, eyes never leaving the Crew Member... who finally, tentatively looks up - BAM! Sator JABS him in the mouth with the gold bar, then SMASHES him over the head - INT. STORAGE AREA, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist is REPULSED by what he sees... INT. ENGINE ROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Sator steps back, breathless, from the Small Crew Member, lies motionless on the ground. As Sator raises his wrist to check his fitness tracker, B drips from the gold bar in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Ninety-eight. Not bad for such exertion. EXT. STORAGE AREA, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS The Protagonist SENSES, TURNS - CRACK! Volkov smashes his - KICKS him in the ribs - pistol-whips him... INT. ENGINE ROOM, SATOR’S YACHT - MOMENTS LATER The Protagonist, bleeding, is SHOVED into the room -—

dialogues.speaker: VOLKOV
dialogues.text: He was at the window. Sator looks at the Protagonist, who nods at the capsule -  69.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I was curious.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: My property shouldn’t concern you. Who are you? How do you come by your information about the opera?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Do I work for intelligence services? Several, just like you. You wouldn’t do business with someone who wasn’t savvy enough to be recruited. Hell, the CIA provides two-thirds of the market for fissile material.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: They're usually buying, not selling. But we do live ina twilight world...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Is that Whitman? It’s pretty.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Next warning’s a bullet in your brain.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No balls in my throat?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: There’1l be no time for such things in Tallinn. Sator gestures to his men - they lift the capsule. The Protagonist spots DRIED MUD from the latches on the table

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Make your way there. I want Volkov on the team. The Protagonist struggles to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No. I spring the materials, you pay me off. Your wife does the exchange.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I never involve her in my business.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: That’s why I trust her.  70.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (to Volkov) Put him ashore.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How do I contact you?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You don’t.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How do you advance me funds? Sator TOSSES the Protagonist the BLOODY GOLD BAR - the Protagonist FUMBLES it onto the table. Volkov SNEERS -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Handle the plutonium better than that. The Protagonist, looking Volkov in the eye, picks up the bar, scooping DRIED MUD into his hand, unseen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist walks the crowded streets with Neil.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What did you find on the gold?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Three hundred thousand at today’s price, no franks, mould marks. Nothing. Like it came from outer space.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Or the future.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Dead drops. He buries his time capsule, transmits the location, then digs it up to collect whatever inverted material they’ve sent.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Instantaneous. Where’s he bury it?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Someplace that won’t be disturbed for centuries. What did the soil sample show?  71.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Northern Europe or Asia, radioactive. Dried blood was European.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Pretty broad.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: This is the start of the run. The Protagonist looks back where they came. Then up ahead

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: When does the material arrive?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Thursday. When does Sator arrive?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But he’1l be here.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Cargo’s in a reinforced truck. Nuclear police front and back - SUVs with serious armour - you can’t break in through the windows.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: And they can’t break out.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I don’t follow.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You will. So, light convoy through downtown, what’s the thinking?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: A crowded, unpredictable traffic pattern makes planning an ambush almost impossible. The Protagonist looks around at the congestion.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: They have a point. Is the convoy monitored from the air?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No, tracked by GPS - a wrong turn or an unscheduled stop, in comes the cavalry. Neil and the Protagonist hop a tram. The Protagonist stud the journey along the multi-lane road out of town.  72.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: We need big guns, guns that make the point without being fired. We need a fast car that doesn’t look fast and four heavy vehicles, all different - bus, coach, eighteen- wheeler... Neil nods.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One of them has to be a fire truck. Neil looks up, interested.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most of all, we need to set this up with nothing in the record - nothing electronic, nothing paper - I don’t want Sator ambushing us the second we spring the material. His ignorance is our only protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat sits beside Sator in the back, staring out the window

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Everything salvaged from Oslo’s been shipped here.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Why am I here?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I don’t trust anyone else to assess the pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MERCEDES pulls into the Tallinn Freeport. Several BODYGUARDS emerge, Sator heads inside. Kat follows, looki through a metal fence - an AUDI sits there, idling. Its driver is wearing an OXYGEN MASK...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat enters. Sator is at a table covered in WEAPONS.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: See, Kat? Some of my favourites... He picks up a MACHINE GUN.  73.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Singed but salvageable, wouldn’t you say? She stares at the weaponry as if she’s never seen anythin like it before...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: It’s not my area of expertise.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: That’s right. You’d never have anything to do with such things. But this is where our worlds collide.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Andrei, what is this?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You know perfectly well what it is, Kat - the filthy business that put those clothes on your back and our boy in his school. That you thought you could negotiate your way around.

dialogues.speaker: VOLKOV
dialogues.text: (in Russian, subtitled) The convoy’s due downtown in ten. Sator checks his watch. Nods at Volkov. Turns to Kat.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: It’s time to go.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m not going anywhere with you. Sator SLAMS the machine gun back down on the table. Kat FLINCHES. Sator TURNS, enraged...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Look at me and understand - you don’t negotiate with a tiger - you admire a tiger, until it turns on you and you feel its TRUE. FUCKING.

dialogues.speaker: NATURE
dialogues.text: Sator moves towards her - Kat pulls out a gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LARGE UNMARKED TRUCK, with an ESCORT FRONT AND BACK, ma its stop and-start way through the downtown traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist and Neil watch the convoy cross an intersection, then pull forward, squeezing through traffi get ahead. Neil raises a walkie-talkie -

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: (into radio) Green? Two minutes. INT./EXT. GREEN TRUCK, TALLINN STREET -— CONTINUOUS The GREEN DRIVER nods at the GREEN CO-PILOT who holds the radio.

dialogues.speaker: GREEN CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: Check. He puts the radio down and pulls out a LARGE AUTOMATIC RI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist checks his watch - Neil speaks into the r

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Yellow? Sixty seconds.

dialogues.speaker: YELLOW CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: (over radio) Sixty. Check.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Blue? Forty-five seconds.

dialogues.speaker: BLUE CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: (over radio) Forty-five. Check.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Red? On our way to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RED DRIVER and RED CO-PILOT are dressed as FIREFIGHTERS.  75.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW pulls out, running behind the nuclear convoy. As convoy passes the cross street where the green truck, a FLATBED TRUCK, is sitting, it pulls out beside them, sett in to the right of the convoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sator steps towards Kat -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Stay right there! She lifts the gun, intent -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You wouldn’t kill me.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I already tried.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You pushed me off a boat. You’re not going to shoot me in cold blood

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: My blood’s not cold, Andrei.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: No, but you’re not angry enough. Sator edges towards Kat...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because anger scars over into despair. I look in your eyes... He casually GESTURES at her -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see despair. He SMACKS the gun out of her hands - PUNCHES her - she DR

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Vengeful bitch. Living off me, pretending to be better... With a primal, animal viciousness, Sator SPITS at Kat.

dialogues.speaker: ENOUGH
dialogues.text: Sator KICKS her once, in the side.  76.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You wanted to know when it’s better to kill you? You'll have your answer. He motions to Volkov, who, with a guard, lifts Kat and carries her towards the door. Sator puts an earpiece in h ear...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me everything as it happens. Volkov nods, leaving - Sator walks through a large door.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seal us this side! As the door shuts behind him, he walks towards a RED DOOR WITH A SMALL PORTHOLE, finding a spot in the shadows nearby...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BMW watches the yellow truck, a BROADCAST TRUCK, whic pulls out just ahead of the nuclear convoy... the Protago looks back through the BMW’s side mirror, which is CRACKE The BMW sees the blue truck, a WRECKER, which pulls out o the larger street, just behind the convoy, which is now SURROUNDED ON THREE SIDES by the coloured trucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volkov follows the convoy...

dialogues.speaker: VOLKOV
dialogues.text: (into radio) Three trucks in place...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (over radio) Watch everything, give me all the details...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sator sits in the shadows, listening intently... EXT. TALLINN STREETS -— CONTINUOUS The BMW ZIPS ahead, weaving through traffic, pulls alongs the fire truck.  77. The Protagonist, DRESSED AS A FIREFIGHTER, jumps out of t BMW and grabs onto the side of the fire truck, BANGING th side to signal the driver. The fire truck pulls out onto three-lane highway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fire truck pulls alongside the nuclear convoy, slotti in on the left, so that the convoy is now SURROUNDED... t Protagonist CLIMBS onto the roof beside the ladder, puts pair of heavy-duty gloves, pulls a diagonal backpack arou onto his front, checking his tools. Blue Co-pilot and Yellow Co-pilot COUNT DOWN in unison -

dialogues.speaker: BLUE CO-PILOT
dialogues.text: (over radio) Five, four, three, two, one, go... Blue truck, behind the convoy, GUNS THE ACCELERATOR, as yellow truck, in front of the convoy, SLAMS ON THE BRAKES The two SUVS are ACCORDIONED against the nuclear truck, t CARRIED FORWARD WITH THE NUCLEAR TRUCK as the coloured tr CLOSE FORMATION and PULL FORWARD, maintaining pace —

dialogues.speaker: BLUE CO-PILOT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go yellow! The YELLOW CO-PILOT in the broadcast truck sends out STAT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SECURITY DRIVER is trying the radio - STATIC...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A POLICE OPERATOR is frowning, trying the radio. He calls his SUPERVISOR -

dialogues.speaker: POLICE OPERATOR
dialogues.text: (in Estonian, subtitled) - Radio’s down. -

dialogues.speaker: SUPERVISOR
dialogues.text: (in Estonian, subtitled) - Are they still moving? - The Police Operator checks his screen - NODS...  78.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TYRES HOWLING, the convoy GRINDS forward - Blue Co-pilot tosses a DYE PACK onto the windshield of the SUV - it BLA across the glass, obscuring the view - Yellow Co-pilot do the same in the front - the Guards are now BLIND, CANNOT

dialogues.speaker: THEIR DOORS OR SHOOT OUT THROUGH THE BULLET-PROOF VEHICLE
dialogues.text: The Protagonist CLIMBS ONTO THE LADDER, lying on top... Inside, the Red Co-pilot operates the ladder controls... The ladder SWINGS OUT AT NINETY DEGREES, hanging the Protagonist DIRECTLY OVER THE NUCLEAR TRUCK... he PULLS a frame from his pack, unfolds it - fixes it to the roof. T ladder SWINGS him away - the frame EXPLODES - he SWINGS b through the smoke to find an OPENING and climbs into -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist lands, gets his bearings, finds the SAFE. reaches into his pack...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Estonian POLICE CAR pulls up behind the fire truck - t POLICEMEN spot SPARKS from the dragging bumper of the SUV the Policeman Passenger tries his radio... STATIC...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist affixes a CHARGE to the safe - he runs a wire, pushing back into the farthest corner - BLASTS the Open -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watching the Police through his mirror, Red Passenger rol down his window and props his ASSAULT RIFLE on the sill..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist reaches into the safe... PULLS OUT an ORA PLASTIC CASE... reaches up to climb through the roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist, orange case in hand, CLIMBS onto the lad - Red Passenger SWINGS his rear-opening door out and SHOO OUT the engine block of the police car which DROPS BACK a  79. The fire-truck ladder SWINGS the Protagonist back onto th fire truck - he climbs down onto the side - the BMW pulls alongside - he JUMPS into the car, which SPEEDS away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, driving, glances at the orange case -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We got it! The Protagonist opens the latches, flips open the lid... revealing the BLACK METAL SHAPE the size of a softball.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’ve seen samples of encapsulation in every weapons class - this is not one of them. Neil looks back at the Protagonist. Serious.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’s what he’s after. The Protagonist looks around at the surrounding traffic..

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Check the radio chatter. Neil clicks on the radio - EMPHATIC GIBBERISH...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I can’t understand -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You said you spoke Estonian -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’s not Estonian, it’s... backwards - Up ahead, an Audi is weaving through traffic, towards the BACKWARDS... Neil STARES...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The hell? The BACKWARDS-RUNNING AUDI flies at them, CLIPPING the wi mirror, ‘HEALING’ its crack. Behind them it SPINS AROUND, CHASE them, still running BACKWARDS... The BMW DODGES around traffic, trying to lose the backwar Audi, which pulls up to the back bumper - then ALONGSIDE the back is Sator, black eyes peering over a RESPIRATOR, gun to Kat’s head. She is BOUND and GAGGED, eyes TERRIFIE  80. Sator rolls the rear window down, holds up his hand, FING EXTENDED. He COCKS the gun at Kat’s head then starts COUN DOWN on his fingers... the Protagonist looks down at the BLACK METAL SHAPE in the case...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t give it to him! The Protagonist LIFTS the closed case, LOWERS the window.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: This isn’t plutonium. Sator is down to TWO FINGERS... Ahead of them in the road the Protagonist sees a CRASHED, SMOKING, UPSIDE-DOWN SAAB

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’s worse, goddammit! Both cars race towards the crashed Saab, which starts SHA as they approach - as they pass, THE CRASHED SAAB ROLLS VIOLENTLY OVER AND OVER between them until it is on its wheels, RACING BACKWARDS ahead of them, UNDAMAGED -— Neil regains his line, looks over at Sator who holds up h LAST FINGER... the Protagonist looks ahead to the Saab, STRUCK BY AN IDEA... the Protagonist looks at Sator - Then TOSSES the orange case at him - The Saab brakes, CUTTING BETWEEN THE TWO CARS... THE ORANGE CASE GLANCES OFF ITS WINDSHIELD, INTO SATOR’S HANDS... A forwards-driving Mercedes pulls up alongside the backwa driving Audi. Sator opens the rear door - he and the Audi driver climb BACKWARDS into the Mercedes - LEAVING KAT IN ACCELERATING BACKWARDS AUDI - the Mercedes DROPS FAR BEHI the BMW, Neil WATCHES -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He’s getting away!

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He left her in the car! Neil looks forward to the backwards Audi, SPEEDING AWAY -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO ONE IS AT THE WHEEL as the car continues to accelerate Kat lies in the back, breathing, groaning, but unconsciou  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist stares ahead at the backwards Audi -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Pull up alongside... Neil looks back at the receding Mercedes, followed by the BACKWARDS SAAB... he turns - RACING to pull alongside the runaway backwards Audi, the Protagonist OPENS his door... - Ahead, a LOGJAM of traffic... The Protagonist FUMBLES to open the Audi door.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Kat! Kat! In the back, Kat swings her bound legs around - - The LOGJAM of cars and buses LOOMS CLOSER... The Protagonist OPENS the Audi door, but his own door hits it SLAMS IT CLOSED AGAIN... - The LOGJAM is DANGEROUSLY CLOSE... The Protagonist OPENS it again, Kat JAMS it open with her feet - the Protagonist CLIMBS ACROSS and PUSHES THE BRAKE WITH HIS HAND... The Audi SKIDS to a halt, the BMW ZOOMING PAST... The Protagonist starts to untie Kat, fumbling with his ra The BMW SKIDS to a halt, Neil JUMPS OUT - a CAR SKIDS to halt between the BMW and the Audi - BLAM, BLAM! Neil DUCK avoiding GUNFIRE -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (over radio) Sit tight - I’m calling in the cavalry.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What cavalry?! SMASH!!! The Protagonist and Kat are THROWN LIKE RAG DOLL across the car - the Mercedes has SWIPED the nose of the Volkov lays down COVER FIRE, pinning Neil as Sator’s men descend on the CRASHED Audi and pull the PROTAGONIST out the car - shoving him around the back of the Mercedes. Ka pulled from the wreck and put into the Mercedes - As they put the Protagonist INTO THE TRUNK, he sees Sator MOVING BACKWARDS behind the line of cars, from the BMW...  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRUNK OPENS - the Protagonist is PULLED OUT. Marched towards an entrance, he sees, through a steel fence divid the yard in two, SATOR, IN RESPIRATOR, WALKING BACKWARDS, PULLING KAT, FORWARDS, TOWARDS A DIFFERENT ENTRANCE... The Protagonist passes a stack of SHIPPING CONTAINERS, several of which are marked OSLO FREEPORT...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist is taken past the table of weapons, throu large door, and through RED DOORS with a PORTHOLE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into A LONG CHAMBER DIVIDED IN TWO BY A GLASS WINDOW - A BIGGER VERSION OF THE ROTAS VAULT. The Russians push the Protagonist into a chair. This side is lit by RED LIGHT. On the other side of the glass, lit by BLUE LIGHT, Sator ‘ENTERS’ BACKWARDS, ‘PULLING’ Kat, who is now in a respirator. Sator ‘SHOVES’ her hard into a chair, removes own respirator, ‘FLIPPING’ it up onto a hook on the wall. The Protagonist looks into Kat’s frightened eyes... betwe them, embedded in a whirl of cracked glass, is a BULLET.. Sator TURNS to meet the Protagonist’s gaze - his movement have the surreal edge of backwards motion as he places hi GUN AGAINST KAT’S HEAD and pulls out his phone... He holds his PHONE up and plays a recording IN REVERSE -—

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) If you’re not telling the truth, she dies. Sator moves the phone to his lips, SPEAKING IN REVERSE... Protagonist stares at him, bemused.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about. Sator listens to this played backwards...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) You left it in the car not the fire truck, right?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Who told you that?  83.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) Tell me, now! Is it really in the

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) Tell me or I’1l shoot her again! The Protagonist looks at Kat, who is TERRIFIED -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (pleading) Tell him! - then at Sator -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Leave her alone!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) I don’t have time to negotiate. The Protagonist looks at the bullet hole in the glass - W OF SMOKE are gathering...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Listen to me! I can help you!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) Three...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Don’t!

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Help me!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) Two...

dialogues.speaker: PLEASE
dialogues.text: A FAINT TRICKLE of glass dust rises to where the bullet i lodged in the window...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Wait!  84.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) One... Sator LIFTS Kat - PUSHES her up against the glass...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No! The SMOKE COALESCES as BANG! The bullet RIPS THROUGH KAT’ SIDE on its inevitable journey to Sator’s gun. Kat SCREAM

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) Next one’s a bullet to the head... He holds up a finger - Kat is SCREAMING -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (via recording) One...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Please!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) Two...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) Three...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Okay! Okay! The car! The BMW! I left it in the BMW! Kat’s screams subside to moans as she PASSES OUT...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) We’re going to check this is real.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: It’s in the glove box! The door OPENS behind the Protagonist -—

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where did you leave it?  85. The Protagonist spins around - Sator, BEHIND HIM, SMASHES gun into the Protagonist’s cheek - THIS SATOR IS FORWARDS

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Car or truck - which one?! Sator HITS him again - the Protagonist falls near the gla looks up through the glass to see ‘backwards’ Sator, on t blue side, staring at him dispassionately...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which vehicle did you leave it in?! I need to know before I go out there!

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I already told you! Forwards Sator looks through the window at his inverse se then turns back to the Protagonist -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I believe you... Sator puts his GUN to the Protagonist’s forehead -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (indicates Kat) You wanted her here. I hope you’1ll be happy together - Sator COCKS his weapon - BLAMBLAMBLAM! - the double doors behind the Protagonist SMASH open - PARAMILITARIES BURST GUNS BLAZING - the two guards are SHOT - Sator JUMPS FOR

dialogues.speaker: VAULT
dialogues.text: On the other side of the glass, INVERTED SATOR runs backw towards the other vault door - BOTH SATORS JUMP INSIDE AND ARE GONE -— A Paramilitary SERGEANT enters, gun drawn -

dialogues.speaker: PARAMILITARY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Clear! The Protagonist looks at the empty vault -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Where'd he go?

dialogues.speaker: PARAMILITARY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: The past.  86.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sator runs out of the turnstile - into the blue side of t room - on the other side he sees the paramilitary AMBUSH REVERSE... for a few seconds he watches his older self interrogate the Protagonist, then fires up his phone, ste up to the glass - the Protagonist SHOUTS PASSIONATELY -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) It’s in the glove box!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: We’re going to check this is real.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) Okay! Okay! The car! The BMW! I left it in the BMW! The sound of Kat’s MOANING is BUILDING and BUILDING. Sato holds up one finger -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Three...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) No! Adds a second finger - Kat is SCREAMING now -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Two...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) Please! And a third -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: One. Next one’s a bullet to the head. Kat’s SCREAM CRESCENDOS as Sator GRABS her and pushes her against the glass, PULLS HIS TRIGGER, ‘HEALING’ her wound

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: One...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) Wait! Holds up two fingers -  87.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Two...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) Don’t! Sator holds up three fingers -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Three -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) Listen to me! I can help you!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I don’t have time to negotiate. The Protagonist looks confused -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) Leave her alone!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Tell me or I’11 shoot her again!

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) I don’t know!

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Tell me now! Is it really in the

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) Who told you that?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You left it in the car not the fire truck, right?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (via recording) I don’t know what you’re talking about.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: If you’re not telling the truth, she dies. Sator GRABS his respirator from the hook, PULLS Kat to he feet - DRAGS her backwards through the door, down a corri into an AIRLOCK, pulls off her respirator, puts his on...  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist looks through the glass at Kat -

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE PARAMILITARY
dialogues.text: She’s been shot!

dialogues.speaker: PARAMILITARY SERGEANT
dialogues.text: Get her this side! Respirator-clad Paramilitaries pull Kat out of the room. Paramilitary Sergeant turns to the Protagonist.

dialogues.speaker: PARAMILITARY SERGEANT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was she shot with an inverted round? The Protagonist NODS. Neil enters - gestures to the Serge

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: This is Ives. He’s one of us - The Protagonist GRABS Neil, THROWS him up against the wal

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Us?! Who are these guys?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Priya’s. Ours. The Paramilitaries bring Kat into the room - the MEDIC, moving SWIFTLY, examines Kat’s wound. The Protagonist puts his arm AGAINST NEIL’S THROAT —

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How did Sator know about the ambush?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Posterity. An ambush on the streets can’t stay out of the record -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Bullshit - he knew every move we made! Somebody talked - was it you?!

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: At every stage, you’ve known more than you should. I’m asking you one more time. Did you talk?  89.

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nobody talked. They’re running a temporal pincer movement. Ives is next to the Protagonist, ready to help Neil...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: A pincer movement. But not in space - in time. Half his team moves forwards through the event - he monitors them, then attacks from the end, moving backwards. Knowing everything.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Except where I stashed the plutonium. The Protagonist lets Neil go...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which is not plutonium, is it?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I told you - it’s what he’s after. And you just told him where it is.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I lied. Neil looks at Kat, bleeding out on the gurney.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He couldn't verify from inside the room, he’d have shot her anyway. Lying is standard operating procedure. The Medic steps away from Kat, shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: It’s spread too far.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Meaning what?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: She’s going to die.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (to Protagonist) Standard operating procedure? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Ives) Can’t you stabilize inverse radiation by inverting the patient?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: That takes days - The Protagonist points at the turnstile -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: We took control of this machine minutes ago - before that it’s Sator’s.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How long will she live on this side?

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: Three hours, tops. The Protagonist thinks. He looks at Kat, who is dying.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’m taking her through. I’m not going to let her die, I’1l take my chances out there.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Chances of what? We’ve got no way to bring you back.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: We find another machine.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: A week ago? Where? The Protagonist looks at Neil - they have the same idea -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Oslo.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: That facility’s impregnable. It’s inside an airport security perimeter.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Not last week, it wasn’t. We’re going in. You might as well help. Ives, shaking his head, joins in. As they carry Kat towar the vault door, Ives points at the glass partition -  91.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: This is the proving window... as you approach the turnstile if you don’t see yourself through the proving window, do not enter the machine.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: If you haven’t seen yourself reverse-exit the machine, you won't be getting out. Okay, first in, last out. Get into the turnstile, pass through - I’1l already be there with her.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Is that gonna work? Ives pauses, watching activity on the other side of the window -

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: (points) Yeah... The Protagonist turns to see HIMSELF on the other side of glass, MOVING IN REVERSE, wheeling KAT ‘TOWARDS’ THE VAUL

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let's go! Ives OPENS the door - the Protagonist takes one last look his backwards self ‘entering’ the machine, then STEPS INS We follow him in as the door SHUTS behind him - he puts h back to the wall - the machine starts CLANKING like an MR the door opens on the other side - he STEPS OUT... To see Ives struggling with Kat - he moves to help - Neil already there (first in, last out). The Protagonist looks through the glass to where he and I now appear to be moving backwards... The Medic tends to Kat.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: She’s stabilizing slowly. I'll clean and close, the rest is time.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How long does she need?  92.

dialogues.speaker: MEDIC
dialogues.text: 4 or 5 days. A week to be sure.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (to Neil) Figure out how to get us to Oslo - I’ve got to get back out there -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: To do what?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: To stop Sator getting away with the whatever it is I just gave him.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You didn’t - you lied about where it was. Wait, you’re going out there for her.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He threatened to kill her in the past... if he does, what happens to her here?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’s unknowable. If you’re there to make a change, you’re not here to observe its effect.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What do you believe?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What’s happened’s happened. We have to save her here and now. And if you go back out there you might hand him exactly what he’s after.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Don’t let them take her back through -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I won't.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: You can’t stay here.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: And we don’t have much time - so find us a nice cosy shipping container that just came off a ship from Oslo... The Protagonist moves towards the door. Ives steps up -  93.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: This is cowboy shit. You have no idea what you’re getting into if you go through that door.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Well, I’m going, so any tips would be welcome. Ives sees determination. Shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Wheeler, brief him. The female Paramilitary, WHEELER, hands the Protagonist a respirator -—

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: You need your own air - regular air won’t pass through the membranes of inverted lungs. The number-one rule - don’t come into contact with your forwards self - that’s the whole point of these barriers - Wheeler BANGS on the proving window -

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And protective suits - if any of your particles came into contact - The Protagonist is putting on the respirator -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: Annihilation.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: That’s bad, right? The Protagonist follows Wheeler into a corridor lined wit RESPIRATORS and HAZARD SUITS... at the end is an AIRLOCK.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: When you exit the airlock, take a moment to orient yourself - things will feel strange. When you run, the wind will be at your back. If you encounter fire, ice will form on your suit, as the transfer of heat is reversed. Gravity will feel normal, but appear reversed for the world around you. Don’t worry about things falling, so much as rising. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you see an object demonstrating unprompted instability, stay clear, it may be about to leap into the air. You may experience distortions to your vision and hearing - this is normal - light waves and sound waves are propagating away from you. This should clear as your brain adjusts.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Can I drive a car?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Cowboy shit. Ives and Neil are grabbing respirators...

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: I can’t vouch for the handling, friction and wind resistance are reversed. You’re inverted, the world is not. You can’t fight the prevailing wind of entropy. Don’t try flying a plane - it’d fall out of the sky. Once again, you’re inverted, the world is not - and those forces will be pushing back on you continuously. The Protagonist turns to Neil -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Was there a transponder on the case?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: He’ll have tossed the case -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’m going backwards - that’s the ball I have to follow. Give me the reader. Neil hands him a phone. The Protagonist sticks a Bluetoot earpiece in his ear, passes into the airlock - Wheeler sh it behind him. Then opens the OUTER DOOR...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist emerges into a strange world - the air fe different, the friction of his feet on the asphalt feels different. He looks up at birds flying backwards... at st contracting... at a pile of dust sucking itself bigger... In the yard he spots the SAAB... he runs over, finds the sitting on the front tyre -  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist LOOKS in the glove box - NOTHING - LOOKS the wheel well - NOTHING - the back seat - NOTHING. He gi up - starts the engine... pulls out, gently, feeling out strange handling of the vehicle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist steers the car around BACKWARDS-MOVING TRAFFIC and BACKWARDS-WALKING PEDESTRIANS, MARVELLING... People STARE at the car as it approaches, as if they alre know a backwards-driven car is heading their way (which, course, they do). He checks the phone - a blinking dot half a mile away - h GUNS it, FISHTAILING unexpectedly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see the fire fight from before IN REVERSE - Neil layin down fire from between cars, Kat carried ‘back’ to the Audi... Behind Neil, Sator, MOVING FORWARDS, checks the glove compartment of the BMW... NOTHING. FUMING, he heads back the Mercedes, DUCKING behind cars, bullets FLYING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist pulls onto a busy highway where the cars FACING HIM, BUT MOVING IN HIS DIRECTION... The Saab races along, the only normal-looking car on a ro full of cars SPEEDING BACKWARDS... On the phone, the flashing dot is CLOSER... Slowing, the Protagonist spots the ORANGE CASE lying empt the side of the road. He PULLS OVER some distance away - JUMPS out of the car - pulls out his BLUETOOTH EARPIECE a WEDGES it between the foam padding and the orange plastic The Protagonist heads back to his car, checks the signal his phone... PEERS at the case... The case SHUDDERS TO LIFE - LEAPS INTO THE WINDOW OF A

dialogues.speaker: PASSING CAR
dialogues.text: The Protagonist PEELS OUT, DUST FLIES UP IN CLOUDS THAT D FULLY BLOSSOM as expected, but CONTRACT... The Protagonist STRUGGLES with the wheel, trying to keep car on the road with its unaccustomed handling...  96.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Christ! He can see the Mercedes up ahead, weaving through traffic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes races back up the off-ramp - the Saab follow weaving through traffic which faces him, but travels backwards - As the Saab gets within a couple car lengths, his phone c in with audio from his Bluetooth bug in the Mercedes -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (over radio) - the material’s not in the case - Sound cuts in and out - FRAGMENTS of voices - he struggle keep pace with the Mercedes - he listens hard -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (over radio) -Get the other sections of the algorithm to the hypocentre- -He was lying- -it wasn’t in the BMW-

dialogues.speaker: INVERTED DRIVER
dialogues.text: (over radio) So where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist finds a clear lane and guns the engine, tracking the Mercedes as it pulls alongside the Audi, rac ‘forwards’, and Sator, orange case in hand, climbs from t Mercedes into the Audi... The Audi pulls alongside the BMW - the Protagonist, sensi the moment, LOWERS HIS WINDOW... Sator lifts the orange c BUT HIS EYES ARE ELSEWHERE —- Inside the Saab, the Protagonist hears BANGING - the BLAC METAL SHAPE ‘unwedges’ from where it’s been stuck down th side of a seat - ‘BOUNCING’ around the interior - The Saab CUTS between the Audi and the BMW - The orange case FLIES OUT OF SATOR’S HANDS - BOUNCES OFF SAAB'S WINDSHIELD, ‘LANDING’ IN THE BMW -

dialogues.speaker: JUST AS THE BLACK METAL SHAPE JUMPS OUT OF THE SAAB AND I
dialogues.text: THE (FORWARD) PROTAGONIST’S LOWER HAND...  97. Sator, SEEING THIS, YANKS the wheel - CLIPS the Saab - th Protagonist STRUGGLES for control - but the Saab SPINS AN ROLLS DOWN THE HIGHWAY, COMING TO REST ON ITS ROOF. The Protagonist, upside down in the car, regains consciousness... fuel leaks, pooling outside the window.. sees expensive shoes approach, then Sator’s face peering at him. In his hand is a LIGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I saw the hand-off. You made me shoot her for nothing. Sator tips his lighter to read his fitness tracker...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You did get my pulse above 130. No one’s done that before. Not even my wife. Backing away, Sator DROPS the lighter, the fuel EXPLODES,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist comes to on a stretcher. Kat is ona stretcher next to him. Neil sits between them. The Protagonist looks at his hands, feels his face, confused.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The heat transfer was reversed - you may be the first case of hypothermia from a gasoline explosion in history.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: At this point, nothing surprises. The Protagonist looks around the shipping container.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You left Ives and his team one hell of a clean-up.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: We’re on our way back to Oslo?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: In a Rotas shipping container.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He’s got the material, Neil. I handed it to him on a plate.  98.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I warned you -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: ‘What’s happened’s happened.’ I get it, now. But it’s tough to take things on trust from people speaking half-truths.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: That’s not fair -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You were part of this before we met. Were you working for Priya?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Who recruited you, Neil?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It can't possibly do you any good to know that right now. When this is over, if we’re still standing and you still care, you can hear my life story, okay? Kat GROANS, her eyes flicker open to see the Protagonist.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I involved you.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You need to tell me what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Apparently, Neil here knows more about it than I do. (to Neil) Good luck, pal.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: By telling Kat anything we’re compromising her in Priya’s eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: In Priya’s eyes she’s already compromised. And she has a right to know why she might die.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m going to die?  99.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Not if we have anything to say about it.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: And we do.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Let me start with the simple stuff. Every law of physics operates the same forwards and backwards, except one. Entropy... The Protagonist moves to the back of the container, pulls his phone, checks Neil’s attention is on Kat...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (via recording) -bring- -final section- -directly to the hypocentre- -with the other parts- -the algorithm- The recording breaks up. The Protagonist puts the phone a FLEXES his elbow, feeling out some pain... He rolls up hi sleeve - there is a DARK PATCH of skin forming -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Are you injured?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What’s the ‘algorithm’, Neil?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The 241 is one section of it. One out of nine. It’s a formula rendered into physical form so it can’t be copied or communicated. A black box with one function.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Inversion. But not objects or people. The world around us.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: As they invert the entropy of more and more objects... Neil holds his hands, fingers spread, pointing at each ot  100.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The two directions of time are becoming more intertwined... He slowly brings his fingers together, into the ‘Tenet’ gesture -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But because the environment’s entropy flows in our direction... He pushes one hand back with the other - Neil nods,

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...we dominate. They’re always swimming upstream. It’s what saved your life - the inverted explosion was pushing against the environment.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Pissing in the wind.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: But the algorithm can change the direction of that wind. It can invert the entropy of the world.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: And if that happens?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Oh, end of play.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: ‘End of play’? Can you be a little more precise?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Our present wiped out, our past obliterated. Everyone and everything who ever lived destroyed instantly. Precise enough?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Including my son. gravely. Kat winces, clearly in pain.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Let me sedate you - the more you sleep the faster you'll heal. Neil injects Kat in the arm. Her eyes close.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close on the hull, we see the water UNSPLASHING at the bo and SUCKING UNDERNEATH the stern as the ship steams majestically backwards through the cold North Sea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANGING wakes the Protagonist - Neil is at a peephole.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We're on a truck. Shouldn’t be too long now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil is awake. He looks over at the Protagonist, who is examining a LESION on his right arm...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You in pain?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Must’ve got nicked in Tallinn. (rolls down sleeve) I’ve been thinking... we’re their ancestors. If they destroy us, won’t that destroy them?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Bringing us to the grandfather paradox.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The classic thought experiment - if you went back in time and killed your own grandfather, how could you have been born to commit the act?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What’s the answer?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: There is no answer, it’s a paradox. But in the future, those in power clearly believe that you can kick Grandpa down the stairs, gouge his eyes and slit his throat without consequence.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Could they be right?  102.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. They believe it, so they’re willing to destroy us. Can I go back to sleep?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No. I thought of something else.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: This reversing the flow of time... doesn’t us being here now mean it never happens? That we stop them?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Optimistically, I’d say that’s right.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Pessimistically?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: In a parallel-worlds theory, we can’t know the relationship between consciousness and multiple realities. Does your head hurt yet?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Try sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A final THUD, then STILLNESS. The Protagonist moves to th peephole, unplugs it and peers out: The WRECKED PLANE, FLOODLIT, sitting outside the COLLAPSE WALL which has been sealed with STEEL FENCING.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Shit. They didn’t take us inside.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: We use the breach. The chaos right after impact. Get ready. They both turn to look at the unconscious Kat.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is she healed enough?  103.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I’ve never done this before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist is at the peephole - the ground is WET. C UP CREWS and INVESTIGATORS swarm backwards over the scene SIRENS start... Water FLOWS UP ONTO THE PLANE’S WINGS. FI CREWS ‘unpack’ their equipment around the wreck...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Fire crew’s there... The Protagonist WINCES as he pulls his arm into its sleev

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We get Kat through the breach, I take care of Sator’s man and secure the vault. Then you bring her in.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: How’s the arm?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Not good. The Protagonist spots a HOLE in the fabric of his black s - directly over the lesion on his arm.. Neil straps a respirator to the gurney - puts the mask ov Kat’s face, then puts another on himself. He gives Kat a sedative.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We move the second we hear the engines. Neil looks at Kat, unconscious on the gurney. He TIGHTENS straps - throws a reflective blanket over her... The SIRENS are DEAFENING - the Protagonist flexes his arm clearly in a lot of pain. Neil spots BLOOD dripping from Protagonist’s wrist -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You're bleeding. Let me take a look SUDDENLY THEY HEAR THE BUILDING WHINE OF JET ENGINES. The Protagonist YANKS up the handle, THROWS OPEN THE DOOR -  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Onto PANDEMONIUM - FIRE CREWS BATTLE the blaze, chunks of metal on the ground IGNITE, SHUDDER and LEAP ONTO THE AIRFRAME... STREAMS of water RISE up onto the plane - The Protagonist HURRIES BACKWARDS, PULLING THE GURNEY tow the plane, steering around debris that might suddenly - A SHEET OF FLAMING METAL SPINS off the ground, shearing i them, KNOCKING the GURNEY - they duck, HOLDING ON TO THE GURNEY, the metal FLIES into the air, SLAMS into its hole the side of the plane... the Protagonist spots a line und the fuselage, between flames, towards the breach...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Come on! Neil looks up as BLACK SMOKE GATHERS, FORMING A MASSIVE C OVER THE PLANE... a SHOCK WAVE starts to BUILD in the air around them - the Protagonist PULLS Kat and Neil under th fuselage as CURTAINS of FIRE start GATHERING around the wings, CENTRED on a HALF-DESTROYED JET ENGINE — They pass through the hole in the wall LICKED AT BY FLAME WHICH LEAVE FROST ON THEIR CLOTHES -— As they clear into the building, DEBRIS in front of them start SHAKING - they DUCK as the MASSIVE BUILD OF ENERGY CLIMAXES in a CACOPHONOUS REVERSE EXPLOSION as THE JET EN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist draws his gun - turns to Neil -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’m going in. Wait here. The Protagonist turns, rushing up onto the loading dock - The LOOSE JET ENGINE, under FULL THRUST, ATTACHED to the wing, SWINGS BACK AND FORTH, wreaking REVERSE HAVOC... The Protagonist pauses, LISTENING - he can hear BACKWARDS VOICES on the other side of a ROLLER DOOR - the loose jet engine TURNS, BLASTING AIR at the Protagonist with its INVERTED THRUST - the Protagonist is SMASHED through the bottom of the roller door -  105. INT. VAULT, FREEPORT —- CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: INTO HIMSELF AND NEIL, DRESSED AS BUSINESSMEN AS IN THEIR
dialogues.text: EARLIER VISIT TO THE ROTAS VAULT - the Protagonist (weari black clothes and gas mask) TACKLES the EARLIER PROTAGONI (wearing business suit), the Earlier Protagonist THROWS t Protagonist onto the ground, getting his gun - SHOUTING at him INCOMPREHENSIBLY - KICKING his INJURED AR AGAIN AND AGAIN - the Protagonist SCREAMS... The Earlier Protagonist puts his GUN TO THE PROTAGONIST’S HEAD... EAR NEIL GRABS HIS ARM, RESTRAINING him... The Protagonist and Earlier Protagonist STRUGGLE, ROLLING across the floor with the unique physics of forward actio merged with backwards action... They STRUGGLE through the BLUE DOOR of the Rotas vault. T Protagonist gets his gun - the Earlier Protagonist STABS in the arm with his lockpick - ‘HEALING’ his wound - ENERGIZING him - He FLIPS the Earlier Protagonist up against the glass, LI his gun - SHOOTS past the Earlier Protagonist’s head, put a BULLET HOLE through the glass - Glancing at the OPEN TURNSTILE DOOR, the Protagonist FIRE again, forcing the Earlier Protagonist TOWARDS the door.. looks through the proving window - no one there...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... The Protagonist FIRES AGAIN AND AGAIN, forcing the Earlie Protagonist closer and closer to the open turnstile... The Earlier Protagonist takes hold of the gun - the barre coming around onto the Protagonist who instinctively EJEC the magazine, REMOVES the SLIDE, tossing it aside, leavin the Earlier Protagonist with a useless STRIPPED AUTOMATIC Earlier Neil RACES backwards into the other half of the r - Through the bullet-riddled glass the Protagonist sees HIMSELF (GAS MASK, BLACK CLOTHES) RUN BACKWARDS into the The Protagonist LEAPS INTO THE TURNSTILE - we FOLLOW the Protagonist through the machine - BURSTING OUT on the oth side - straight into Earlier Neil, who now MOVES FORWARDS the Protagonist PUSHES past - As the confrontation on the other side of the glass plays again, FORWARDS... the Protagonist RACES for the RED DOOR Neil in PURSUIT -  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist runs, pursued by Earlier Neil, skidding around the corners of the vault corridor - Earlier Neil gets a hand on the Protagonist’s GAS MASK an YANKS - it comes off in his hands... this time we see tha Neil is looking at the UNMASKED PROTAGONIST. Neil, surpri turns and BOLTS back the way he came - the Protagonist watches him go, then TURNS -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist races down the angled corridor - The Protagonist SKIDS through the doorway leading out of corridor and into the SMOKE-FILLED cargo area where he left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil races up to the Earlier Protagonist, grab his arm -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: NO! Don’t kill him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-Neil (respirator on) guarding Kat, STRAPPED to the gu Behind them, the fire crew battle the blazing plane. Neil already looking up at the Protagonist who POINTS right - Protagonist DUCKS THROUGH the breach, into the chaos... N moves BACKWARDS towards the outside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist RUNS THROUGH THE SMOKE AND FLAME, DODGING DEBRIS FALLING FROM THE PLANE... heading towards the EMERGENCY SERVICES... The Protagonist CREEPS along the side of an AMBULANCE... AMBULANCE DRIVER spots him in the mirror - the Protagonis DARTS in, HITTING the driver in the face -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil (moving FORWARDS) ducks back behind the corner as Earlier Protagonist (business suit) and Earlier Neil (business suit) walk backwards away from the Rotas vault. Neil pushes Kat towards the broken roller door and pushes inside...  107.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist SWERVES the ambulance, trying to get clos the breach - the Protagonist SPINS the ambulance around a close to the breach as possible. He JUMPS out - opens the back - PEERS into the smoke and water... waiting... Neil EMERGES, pushing the gurney with Kat on -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist DRIVES, sirens blaring.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You knew it was me coming out of that vault. Why didn’t you say?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: That’s a lot of explaining when someone’s about to put a bullet in their own brain.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: But afterwards -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: With things the same, I knew you’d be okay. What’s happened happened. If I'd told you and you acted differently... who knows? The policy is to suppress.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Whose policy? Neil GRINS, offering his hand -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Ours, my friend. We’re the people saving the world from what might have been...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil and the Protagonist are in the back, checking on Kat whose eyes OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Kat?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m here. Neil checks the dressing on her wound -  108.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Be quite a scar, but you’re okay. We did it.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Did what? Andrei’s got the algorithm. You don’t know where he is - Neil looks at the Protagonist -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Or when.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Get Priya here to Oslo.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: If I don’t do something now, in two days she’1ll tell me about the 241.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Nothing can change that.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: We'll see. Just get her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist makes his way through the crowd, followin elegantly dressed lady... Priya. He takes her by the arm, away from the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Hello, Priya.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: What’s going on? Where’s Neil?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Nursing Katherine Barton. Who almost died because of you.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: It’s what you’re going to do. In two days you’re going to have me dangle plutonium 241 in front of the world’s most dangerous arms dealer... I want to know why.  109.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: You let him get hold of 241?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No. I let him get hold of the algorithm. Priya looks at the Protagonist, surprised he knows the te

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell me about it, Priya.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: It’s unique. The scientist who built it took her own life so she couldn't be forced to make another.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
