dialogues.text: A scientist in the future?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Generations from now.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Why did she have to kill herself?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: You're familiar with the Manhattan Project? As they approached the first atomic test, Oppenheimer became concerned the detonation might produce a chain reaction, engulfing the world.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: They went ahead anyway, and got lucky.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Think of our scientist as her generation’s Oppenheimer - she devises a method for inverting the world, but becomes convinced that by destroying us, they destroy themselves.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: The grandfather paradox.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Unlike Oppenheimer, she rebels, splitting the algorithm into nine sections and hiding them the best place she can think of...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: The past. Here. Now.  110.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: There are nine nuclear powers. Nine bombs. Nine sets of the most closely guarded materials in the history of the world. The best hiding places possible.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Nuclear containment facilities.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Sator’s lifelong mission, financed and guided by the future, has been to find and reassemble the algorithm.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Why did they choose him?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: The necessary combination of greed and ambition. But mostly, he was in the right place at the right time.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: The collapse of the Soviet Union.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: The most insecure moment in the history of nuclear weapons.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: And there he was. How many of the sections does he have?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: After the 241? All nine.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Christ. And that’s why you’re going to do it differently this time.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: To change things? So Katherine won’t get hurt?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: So Sator won’t get the algorithm.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: If that universe can exist, we don’t live in it.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Let’s try. You’re going to warn me.  111.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: No. I’m not. Ignorance is our ammunition. If you’d known what the algorithm was, would you have let it fall into Sator’s hands?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You want him to get the last section?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: It’s the only way he'll bring together the other eight.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I was supposed to steal it, then lose it?

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Mission accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You used me.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: As you used Katherine. Standard operating procedure. You’ve done your part.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: My part? I’m the protagonist of this operation -

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: You're a protagonist. (off look) What? You thought you were the only person capable of saving the world?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No. But I am. Because I haven’t told you where he’s assembling the algorithm, or when.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: You’re about to.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No, I’m not. So deal us in.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Why would you involve her again?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: She can get close to him.  112.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Does he still trust her?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He thinks she’s dead. But he used to.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: You have started looking at the world in a new way.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: And now it’s your turn. Assuming she makes it out alive, whether or not you feel she knows too much...

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: If you don’t have the authority, talk to whoever’s in charge of loose ends. I need your word that she and her son will be safe.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: (frustrated) What good is someone’s word in our line of business? The Protagonist just looks at her. She NODS.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They'll be safe. There’s a rally point offshore at Trondheim. Get yourselves up there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chinooks cross BACKWARDS through WHITE TURBINES. Service boats pull people off ladders. A large ICEBREAKER sits ne EXT. ICEBREAKER, BARENTS SEA —- CONTINUOUS The Protagonist, IN RESPIRATOR, does PULL-UPS on deck, th movement ‘shaking’ snow back up onto the pipe...

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Ives has a team ready to invert. CUT BACK TO THE PROTAGONIST IN OSLO -—  113.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You have a turnstile? The exact technology we’re trying to suppress?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist watches a CHINOOK long-line a container..

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fighting fire with fire is a treacherous business, but there are people in the future who need us to continue the algorithm’s journey into the past. You see... Taking a look at the sea CHURNING BACKWARDS into the ster the inverted ship ‘progresses’, he heads below deck...

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: ...Tenet wasn’t founded in the past - it will be founded in the future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming out of an AIRLOCK, he removes his respirator. Walk past Wheeler drilling TENET SOLDIERS - non-inverted soldi in respirators SPAR with inverted soldiers. Neil is among troops practising ‘LIFTING’ weapons from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist enters. Kat sits at a window.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I can’t get over the birds... The Protagonist follows her look to a bird flying backwar

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How are you feeling? She lifts her shirt to reveal a LARGE, JAGGED, ANGRY SCAR

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Tell me you're going to kill him.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I can’t. Neil enters without interrupting. Kat rises. Steady.  114.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Why not? I think you’ve probably killed a lot of people -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Not with a dead man’s switch.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: That fitness tracker he wears...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: He’s obsessive about his health.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: It’ll be linked to a switch. Probably a simple email burst, revealing the location of the dead drop, set to fire if his heart stops.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: In effect, his death activates the algorithm. He dies, the world ends - no one dares kill him. Kat realizes...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: No, you’ve missed the point. He’s intending to end his life.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: He’s dying. Inoperable pancreatic cancer.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: And he’s taking the world with him.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: If he can’t have her, no one can.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Something he said, once. He has a child, for God’s sake.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Kat, he gets to choose the time and place for the end of the world. What moment? What does he choose?  115.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You told me about a holiday, where you let him feel loved...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Viet Nam. On our yacht. His yacht.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You said he vanished - what day?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I went ashore with Max, he flew off. I don’t know what date it was...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The 14th. Ten days ago. He was in Ukraine, stealing a section of the algorithm from an American team.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: At the Kiev Opera siege. How do you know about that?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: The point is - he wasn’t on the yacht, so that’s his window.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: To come back to that golden moment and have it be his last.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Everyone’s last. We have to lift the algorithm from the dead drop without Sator knowing. If he believes it’s in there, he kills himself.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: And not the rest of us. Where’s the dead drop?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Knowledge divided, friend.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You’re not going to tell me?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Ignorance is our ammunition. (turns to her) But I need you back on that boat.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You have to stop him killing himself until we know that algorithm is out of the dead drop.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: But if I’m caught there... and my son sees... I don’t want those moments full of anguish if they’re going to be his last.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: They’re not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist watches the troops prepare.

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Cough it up. It’s time. The Protagonist turns to face Ives.

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're working our way back to the 14th. But without knowing where the dead drop is, there’s only so much I can prepare. (no response) You need me to get you there.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Know what a hypocentre is? Ives shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ground zero for an underground nuclear test. Sir Michael Crosby told me about a detonation at Stalsk-12 on the 14th - the dead drop is at the bottom of the hypocentre. That explosion seals up the algorithm.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Then we'd better pull it out of that hole before the bomb goes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers in respirators file into the turnstile. Through proving window we see them ‘back’ into the exit... The Protagonist checks his gear at the back of the line. He s Kat watching from the airlock. He goes to her.  117.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist pulls off his respirator.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Where’s Neil?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: He must’ve already gone through...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I didn’t get to say goodbye - this is goodbye, isn’t it?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Today’s the 14th. Offshore of Siberia - time for us to go. You keep going back another day, give you time to make it to Viet Nam.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Who gets me back on the yacht?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I’ve got somebody good lined up. I'd like to say you don’t have to do this, but...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I once told you I didn’t need redemption. But the chance to save my child? You can’t know what that means to a mother.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: The worst thing Andrei ever did to me was that offer - to let me go if I never saw my son again. I shouted, swore — INSERT CUT: Kat FLINGS a crystal BOWL OF RASPBERRIES, SMASHING it on a wooden deck...

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But he’d seen it on my face - just for an instant. Kat looks at the Protagonist. Who says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know if I hate him more for the things he’s done, or because he knows that about me. You’ve killed people you hated before?  118.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: It’s not usually personal.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: He’s dying, anyway. It might not even count -—

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: It always counts. You’re not there to kill him - you’re the backstop. If we haven't lifted that algorithm and he kills himself, he takes us all with him, instantly. Kat moves to the Protagonist, in close -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Just keep up your end, okay? The Protagonist nods. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: When it’s over, and you’re raising your boy. Carry this - The Protagonist hands her a DUMB PHONE.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There may be a time and place you feel threatened. Hit talk, state your location, hang up.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Who gets the message?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Posterity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist watches the icebreaker recede...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three CHINOOKS zoom low across the barren landscape, foll by another three CHINOOKS long-lining SHIPPING CONTAINERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist sits amongst a DOZEN SOLDIERS. They watch endless northern plain unroll beneath them...  119. EXT. TENET CAMP — CONTINUOUS The Protagonist gets off the Chinook, watching another Chinook gently set down a container. He follows the other a tent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soldiers in folding chairs facing a screen. The Protagoni looks around - still no Neil. Ives steps up, signals for projector: a devastated CITY, grey CONCRETE and ABANDONED industry amongst terraced strip mines...

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Stalsk-12. Hidden from the world. A city where anything can happen, and today, gentlemen, for ten minutes, it most assuredly does. Ives switches to a GRAPHIC: a childishly simple diagram o LANDING AREA, BUILDINGS, then an UNDERGROUND CAVERN...

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You were divided into two teams for a temporal pincer movement. We are Red team, moving forwards. Our friends out there - (gestures at containers) - Blue team, led by Commander Wheeler, are inverted. One hour from now, they had this briefing... INSERT CUT: Neil, in RESPIRATOR, in the front row of Commander Wheeler’s briefing of BLUE TEAM. All are in respirators...

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Then were dropped on the ridge above the hypocentre as close in time to the detonation as possible. Their objectives were clearance and clarification. This briefing has the benefit of their experience - and yes, some of you specialists are on both teams. The Protagonist overhears -—

dialogues.speaker: RED SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Why don’t they let us see them?

dialogues.speaker: RED SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: Maybe we won’t like what happened.  120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SPEEDBOAT bounces through the chop, Mahir (from the freeport heist) at the helm. Kat, beside him, shields her eyes from the glare as they head towards Sator’s yacht. T pull up some way off. A chopper sits on the yacht. Mahir hands Kat binoculars - Kat watches her EARLIER SELF HER SON board the tender and head for shore...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ives gestures across the whole area on the schematic -

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: The entire area is radioactive, so both teams wear full protection. To distinguish teams, wear these - A soldier starts passing out RED ARMBANDS... INSERT CUT: Neil, in respirator, takes a BLUE ARMBAND, an like the rest of the team, puts it on...

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO RED-TEAM BRIEFING -
dialogues.text: Ives points to each of the three elements in turn:

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Landing zone, LZ, well defended, including ground-to-air ordinance. We drop in, clear the LZ for Blue team’s evacuation... We make our way into the city proper... these buildings are abandoned, but we learned they have a turnstile in this one... so expect a bi-temporal response.

dialogues.speaker: RED SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: They’1l have inverse ordinance?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Inverse, conventional, forwards antagonists, inverted antagonists - they have it all, and it can all end you. Got it? Ives goes back to the diagram -

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On the other side of the city, the ground rises to the ridge above the hypocentre. yP (MORE )  121.

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Most of you will proceed up the hill - a splinter unit will take a tunnel from the city to the floor of the hypocentre. Blue team located an entrance here - Ives points to the city’s edge. Then to the CAVERN.

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The bomb is in the rock high above to trigger a collapse, sealing the cavern.

dialogues.speaker: RED SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: How do we defuse the bomb up there?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: We don’t. The explosion takes place as planned, exactly ten minutes after our landing. Everything is synchronized to that explosion. Both teams have countdown watches - ours counts down from ten at landing, to zero at the explosion. He holds up his wrist to display a BLOOD-RED ‘10’ -

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Blue team is the reverse - INSERT CUT: a PREVIOUS BRIEFING (BLUE TEAM). NEIL watches Wheeler holds up her wrist to show a VIVID-BLUE ‘10’ -

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: Ten at the explosion, to zero at our extraction. If you are not at the LZ by zero, you are not leaving.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Our job is to fail to defuse the bomb, while the splinter unit achieves its task undetected.

dialogues.speaker: RED SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Which is?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Need to know. And you don’t. Any other stupid questions? Right, let’s get ready. Everybody RISES. The Protagonist approaches Ives.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I wanted to be on the first wave.  122.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: There is no first wave - Red team and Blue team operate simultaneously. Do not get on the chopper if you can’t stop thinking in linear terms. You want to be on the team who lifts the contents of that capsule?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: That's us. We're the splinter unit.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Just us?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: No one who knows the contents of that capsule can leave the field. I thought we’d manage ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mahir shows Kat how to use a small pistol. Kat wears a tw piece bathing suit with a shirt over. He puts the pistol diver’s bag, loops the lanyard round Kat’s bare ankle.

dialogues.speaker: MAHIR
dialogues.text: It's forty feet from the private deck to the water. Can you jump it?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I can dive it. They hear the chopper SPIN UP. Mahir shows her a FLARE GU

dialogues.speaker: MAHIR
dialogues.text: Until you see my signal, you don’t let him die. Kat nods. The chopper lifts off and ZOOMS overhead. Mahir guns the powerboat, STREAKING towards the yacht...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Soldiers head for the Chinooks. As they pass the containers, some stare at them... the Chinooks lift off, Chinooks rise, LIFTING the containers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mahir pulls up fifty yards from the stern of Sator’s yach Kat grabs the pistol bag and slips into the water...  123.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinooks BEAT LOW over the windswept plain. Stalsk-12 appears on the horizon - terraced strip-mined land leadin a set of CONCRETESTRUCTURES FUSED TO THE EARTH... EXT. SATOR’S YACHT, COAST OF VIET NAM - DAY Kat quietly pulls herself out of the water and onto a rea platform. She STEALTHILY makes her way up through the boa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinooks long-lining containers RISE, slowing, as the other Chinooks BARREL in towards a large flat area - ANTI AIRCRAFT GUNS start FIRING... The Protagonist grabs his gun and LEAPS from the Chinook it hovers close to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinooks long-lining containers fly BACKWARDS towards giant DEPRESSION...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil looks out a peephole -

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: We’re coming in on the shock wave... hang on, people! - Neil GRABS his belts as WHUMMMMM!!!! The container SHUDDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOCK WAVE CONTRACTS - the Chinook ‘SURFING’ backward on the shock as it approaches the hypocentre... ENERGY BUILDING... GROUND LIFTING AND FLATTENING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist joins a unit of Red team soldiers who CHA an antiaircraft emplacement TAKING IT OUT BEFORE IT CAN F ON THE SLOW-MOVING CHINOOKS... The Protagonist uses his assault rifle to take out a gunemplacement. Ives uses an inverse grenade to violently ‘reassemble’ an enemy gun emplacement out of existence, shredding the enemy with reverse shrapnel...  124.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Draw them back into the city, away from Blue team... The Chinooks drop down, land the containers - the Protago looks back to see, a hundred metres away, the containers - Blue team ‘SCRAMBLING’ BACKWARDS from the containers... SOME CARRY INJURED COMRADES, ALL SEEM EXHAUSTED... The Protagonist and Red team press forward, blasting at t remaining enemy troops who run for the cover of the city. the Protagonist checks his watch - a BRIGHT-RED ‘9:59’, ‘9:58’...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The reverse explosion PEAKS. SUDDEN CALM as the Chinooks place the containers down - they open and Blue team runs ‘FORWARDS’, Neil at the head, guns raised, BLASTING at the ENEMY SOLDIERS on ridge... Neil checks his watch - a BRIGHT-BLUE ‘9:57’, ‘9:56’... he turns to see a GREY TRUCK ‘REVERSING’ toward the hole, tyres sucking up dust... a rope from its rear h TAUT into the hole... BANG! BANG! SHOTS are sucked out of the ground around him Blue team FORCES the enemy away from the hole, towards Re team (whose members fight ‘backwards’) - Neil shouts to Wheeler -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Draw their fire! Pull them away... He RACES down the ridge, following Wheeler... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Kat comes out to find a JUNIOR CREW MEMBER cleaning up a SMASHED BOWL OF RASPBERRIES. He looks up at her, surprise

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: Ma’am? We thought you’d gone ashore.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I snuck back to surprise Andrei.

dialogues.speaker: JUNIOR CREW MEMBER
dialogues.text: The Boss left... He trails off - they hear an INCOMING CHOPPER.  125.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’ll get the mess. Have Mr Sator find me here. Don’t tell the others. The Junior Crew Member nods, leaves - Kat moves to the RA checks Mahir in the distance, the DAYBED, the water HOSE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist, Ives and Red team head towards the large concrete turnstile building on the outskirts of the city The Protagonist sees Wheeler running backwards towards a BUNKER on their right which UNEXPLODES - - GUNFIRE CRACKLES around them, pinning them down... They hit the bunker with an RPG, then race around the lef the turnstile building...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler leads Blue team down the hill - ‘chasing’ the ene who run BACKWARDS - a BLUE TEAM member TRIGGERS A LANDMIN another triggers an INVERSE LANDMINE -

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: Hit the deck! Mines! As Blue team goes to the ground, Neil sees mines start to EXPLODE/IMPLODE in a wave towards him as the GREY TRUCK R BACKWARDS down the hill through the minefield, REVERSE- TRIGGERING THE MINES - Neil DIVES out of the way, almost over... Then gets up to follow the ‘path’ of the grey truck... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Kat unzips the diver’s bag, feels the handle of the gun, slides the bag under the daybed, checking she can reach. moves to the rail, crouches to UNCLIP the bottom safety cable. She looks at Mahir’s boat across the water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ives leads Red team into the deserted concrete structures an efficient cover-and-move formation... the Protagonist shelters behind LARGE CONCRETE CHUNKS. Which VIBRATE... GATHERING ENERGY...  126. The Protagonist JUMPS AWAY as the chunks RIP FROM THE GRO

dialogues.speaker: BOUNCING VIOLENTLY, DUSTILY OFF EACH OTHER AND FLYING UP
dialogues.text: A GAP IN THE SIDE OF A BUILDING as an INVERSE RPG ZIPS ba up into a WINDOW - Ives has spotted the window and calls for an RPG to ‘foll the inverse one, BLASTING the building... the Protagonist checks his watch - ‘8:10’, ‘8:09’...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil checks his watch - ‘8:08’, ‘8:07’... he heads downhi towards the city, where the rest of Blue team BEAT BACK t enemy... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Kat hoses the raspberries and glass from the deck... Sato appears, watching as she turns the water on herself.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: They told me you’d gone ashore.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: They told me you’d flown off.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I came back. To see you and Max.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Max is on shore with Anna. We need time, just you and me. After what -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I was joking. A stupid joke -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You think I’m a terrible mother.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: We both know my opinion of you is higher than yours of me.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I want things to be better, Andrei. She moves towards him. Sator nods. Picks up the phone -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Have the captain turn the boat so we'll see the sunset from here.  127.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist RUNS across the street, FIRING at the enemy... he SPOTS the TUNNEL ENTRANCE between two buildin

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Ives! Splinter unit here! Ives nods. RACES over, drawing fire the whole way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil races into the city streets... he sees Commander Whe and a BLUE SOLDIER take shelter in a large jagged BREACH the ground-floor wall of a massive structure. Neil is FORCED to hit the deck, ducking INVERTED fire all around... he looks over at Wheeler, and sees DUST GATHERI AROUND THE BREACH...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Wheeler! Get out of there! Wheeler! Wheeler hears him - tries to grab the Blue Soldier - MASS CHUNKS OF CONCRETE SCRAPE OVER NEIL’S HEAD, FLYING TOWARD WHEELER, who DIVES CLEAR - the wall REASSEMBLES ON TOP OF Blue Soldier, CRUSHING HIM... Neil winces. Starts crawling for better cover... checks h watch - ‘6:24','’6:23’... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Sator looks past Kat to the lowering sun.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: It’s going to be a beautiful sunset. I’1l get Max brought back - we should share the moment with him. Sator picks up the phone. Kat looks at the shore, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ives and the Protagonist shelter as Red team exchanges fi with the Enemy further up the street. The Protagonist che his watch - ‘5:15’, ‘5:14’...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Let’s go. We’re running out of time.  128.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: If they see us, it’s all for nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: We need a distraction. Ives looks ahead to the LEANING RUIN OF A BUILDING TOP...

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about that...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil checks his watch - ‘5:10’, ‘5:09’... frustrated, pin down, he looks around for a way to break cover... Commander Wheeler, with the rest of Blue team, SHELTERS i the shadow of the RUINED BASE of a building, pinned by EN FIRE from the base of the building...

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: RPG! Take out the base - on my mark She checks her watch - ‘5:04’, ‘5:03’... The BLUE RPG SOLDIER takes aim...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist spots SMALL DEBRIS ROLLING across the street... GATHERING MOMENTUM...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Ives! Ives sees LARGER and LARGER debris is ROLLING down the st towards the LEANING RUIN OF A BUILDING TOP...

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: It’s about to get distracting... He signals a RED RPG SOLDIER...

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: On my mark! He looks at his watch - ‘5:01’, ‘5:00’ -

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fire! The leaning ruin THRUSTS UPWARDS -  129.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler watches as the Leaning Ruin’s UPPER STOREYS REASSEMBLE, as its BASE EXPLODES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist takes cover as the Leaning Ruin’s BASE REASSEMBLES as its UPPER STOREYS EXPLODE... the Protagoni and Ives race at the tunnel entrance - the GREY TRUCK RAC at them as they dive for the tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler ducks as the weight of the upper storeys COLLAPSE the building... Neil lifts his head after the EXPLO/IMPLOSION. Clear. He up and starts RUNNING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist and Ives RACE into the tunnel, HITTING A

dialogues.speaker: THEY JUMP INSIDE...
dialogues.text: EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Sator hangs up. He holds a SILVER PILL in the sunlight, studying it...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I borrowed it from the CIA.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: But what is it?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: The way the world ends, not with a bang but a whimper.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I don’t understand.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: When I take this, it’s all over.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Then don’t take it, yet. Sator looks at her, needing her to care.  130.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: We've got the sunset coming and a little vodka left...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: And Max will be here soon... they thought it was you, not Anna, on shore with Max. Kat steps up in front of Sator, seductive...

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: As long as you can tell the difference... Sator smiles appreciatively, but pulls out his phone -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: A moment’s business, my love... EXT. MAHIR’S BOAT - CONTINUOUS Mahir checks his radio -

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: (over radio) Not clear. Repeat, not clear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist and Ives look back at the COLLAPSED ENTRA

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: We’re committed now. They turn and RACE through the mining tunnel...

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: (into radio) Just hold tight - we’re almost there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil spots SATOR’S GREY MI8 OVERHEAD, a rope hanging down Across the street he sees VOLKOV REVERSE-EXIT the tunnel mouth, CROUCHING to ‘DERIG’ a tripwired booby trap, carry it towards the chopper, then LEAPING up onto the line - RISING from the streets...  131. Neil STARES. CONCERNED. Checks his watch - ‘4:10’, ‘4:09’ Then TAKES OFF, SPRINTING -

dialogues.speaker: WHEELER
dialogues.text: Neil! She watches him go ahead, then signals Blue team to keep pushing forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist and Ives run down the tunnel... they slow they see a BODY, blue armband, lying on the ground on the opposite side of a SET OF BARS at the end of the tunnel. They can see into the hypocentre, the GIANT ATOMIC-HEWN CAVERN, daylight above, CAPSULE on the rock floor next to mouth of a BORE HOLE. The Protagonist checks his watch - ‘4:06’, ‘4:05’ ... Ives checks the ELECTRONIC LOCK -

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: We don’t have anything big enough to blow this. Try him - The Protagonist reaches through the bars and checks the b - FREEZES: attached to a zip, a TALISMAN - A COIN WITH A HANGING FROM A SMALL LENGTH OF ORANGE AND YELLOW STRING.. The Protagonist looks at it, quizzical, rises -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Nothing. Can you pick it?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I hope not. I paid a lot for that lock... WHAM! Ives goes down - SHOT BY VOLKOV, bullet SPARKING of his helmet - on the other side of the bars - gun pointed the Protagonist, FIELD RADIO held out... Sator’s voice EC through the tunnel -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (over phone) How do you like where my journey began, and yours ends? Volkov takes the Protagonist’s gun. Forces him to push Iv gun through the bars.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: A little radioactive for my taste. Volkov drops the guns into the water, places the radio by bars...  132. EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - LATE AFTERNOON Sator steps away from Kat as he speaks quietly into the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: My fate was always bound up with radiation. We’d work where no one else would. We made a devil’s bargain - money for time. We sold our futures. Kat looks at Mahir’s boat. Nothing. She looks to the shor Far in the distance, she can see the TENDER APPROACHING..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist looks at Volkov. At the bars between him the capsule...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Now you’re making the same mistake for the entire world.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (over phone) It wasn’t a mistake. I made the bargain I could. What was yours? You fight for a cause you barely understand. With people you trust so little you’ve told them nothing about what you’re doing. When I die the world dies with me. And your knowledge dies with you. Buried in the tomb like an anonymous Egyptian builder sealed in the pyramid to keep his secret...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil comes into the turnstile room... he watches ENEMY TR enter/exit the machine, inverting to join the battle. He waits for his chance... the room is empty... he sees hims through the proving window, and RUNS at the machine... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - EVENING Sator speaks into his phone -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Your faith is blind. You’re a fanatic.  133.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (over phone) What’s more fanatical than trying to destroy the world? Kat moves towards Sator, but he raises a finger...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: I’m not. I’m creating a new one. Somewhere, sometime, a man ina crystalline tower throws a switch and Armageddon is both triggered and avoided. Entropy inverts the same way the magnetic poles have switched 183 times over the millennia. Now time itself switches direction. Sator looks out at the lowering sun...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The same sunshine we’ve basked in will warm the faces of our descendants generations from now. Kat looks at Mahir’s boat. Nothing. She looks to shore, watching the TENDER APPROACHING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist looks at his watch - ‘2:12’, ‘2:11’...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: How can they want to destroy us?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (over phone) Because their oceans rose and their rivers ran dry. Don’t you see -? Their world shrivelled because of us. They have no choice but to turn back, there’s no life ahead of them. And we’re responsible. Knowing this, do you still want me to stop?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Yes. Each generation looks out for its own survival. EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Sator looks out at the glittering water -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: That’s exactly what they’re doing.  134.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (over phone) Sure, but not you. You’re a traitor. Bringing death to all because you have no life of your own left.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: When I’m done, life continues.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (over phone) Not your son’s.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: My greatest sin was to bring a son into a world I knew was ending... do you think God will forgive me?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (over phone) For killing your son? No.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: He should understand - he killed his own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil, FORWARDS NOW, spots a GREY TRUCK outside the turnst building - he jumps in, FIRING IT UP -

dialogues.speaker: RACING THROUGH THE STREETS, PAST THE IMPLODING/ EXPLODING
dialogues.text: BUILDING, racing for the tunnel mouth, trying to head off Protagonist and Ives -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Wait! Wait! They dive into the tunnel, which COLLAPSES. Neil sets his sights on the hypocentre ridge above, GUNS the engine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler leads Blue team towards the CHINOOKS LOWERING CONTAINERS... as they carry their wounded and lurch towar the containers, they see Red team ‘REASSEMBLING’ the anti aircraft guns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist watches Volkov pick up a BLACK, METAL, GEOMETRICALLY COMPLEX BAR... the algorithm.  135.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You don’t believe in God. Or a new future. Or anything outside your own experience.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (over phone) That’s all any of us knows. The rest is belief, and I don’t have it.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Without it you’re not human. You’re a madman.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (over phone) Or a god of sorts.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Like I said. Volkov slowly backs towards the capsule with the algorith The Protagonist looks down at Ives - whose hand is MOVING EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS A BEEP. Sator checks his watch.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Our time is up. He looks across at Kat standing by the rail.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I‘1l give my wife your love.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (over phone) You're forgetting, I haven’t met her, yet.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: That's right, after you meet her, she dies. I’1l just give her my love, instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volkov seals the capsule - hooks it to a winch... the Protagonist watches Ives’s hand emerge with a SIDEARM... Volkov raises the capsule up over the mouth of the DEEP B HOLE, then steps back, preparing to release the winch and drop the capsule into the well...  136. EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - SUNSET Sator goes to hang up, pauses... an afterthought -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Volkov?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Volkov RUSHES FORWARD with his gun...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (over phone; in Russian, subtitled) - Shoot him in the head. - Volkov PULLS HIS TRIGGER - but the Dead Tenet Soldier has ‘RISEN’ to be in front of the gun ‘ABSORBING’ the bullet then LEAPING to one side, ALIVE - EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - CONTINUOUS Sator hears the shot, SATISFIED - Kat pulls the phone awa

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Enough business, Andrei...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist DIVES to where Ives is lying, GRABS his g Volkov TURNS, RUNNING FOR the winch-release -

dialogues.speaker: WAIT
dialogues.text: He FIRES at Volkov, who goes down just short of the winch Ives struggles to his feet, checking his watch - ‘1:07’, 41:06’... Hearing BEEPS, Ives looks up. THE LOCK is open -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil RACES up the slope to the ridge - through the MINEFI setting off personnel mines in his wake, NARROWLY AVOIDIN RUNNING HIMSELF OVER... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - EVENING As Kat pours him a drink, Sator looks out at the glowing horizon, fiddling with the silver pill... he POINTS -  137.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Tomorrow the sun will rise in that same spot. For the first time in history. Because I’ve told it to. (looks at her like she’s a loyal dog) You have no idea what I’m talking about, do you? She looks at him, smiles sweetly.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: It sounds terribly important, Andrei. He reaches for her - she gets up, moves to the rail -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Where’re you going? She grabs the hose, starts spraying herself -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Aren’t you hot? Kat sprays the deck in front of the rail -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: What’re you doing, now?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I spilled sunscreen.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: It's slippery.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Just come here... She looks at Sator lying on the daybed like an appalling emperor. Moves towards him. Grabs the sunscreen.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Turn over.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: The sun’s almost gone.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: You'll like it. He rolls over, obedient. She squirts a large dollop acros his back. Looks up at Mahir’s boat, hopeful. Nothing.  138. She checks her watch as she lazily smears the sunscreen across Sator’s back. He groans. Kat watches the TENDER APPROACHING, she can just make out HERSELF AND HER SON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist watches the Dead Tenet Soldier RACING BACKWARDS from the gate, out of the tunnel -

dialogues.speaker: COME ON
dialogues.text: The Protagonist TURNS - Ives swings the gate open - they through, just before it closes, SLAMMING SHUT behind them

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tunnel’s sealed! The Protagonist steps over Volkov, STRUGGLES with the capsule, it swings, HANGING precariously over the well...

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (into radio) Mahir, do you copy? EXT. MAHIR’S BOAT - EVENING Mahir looks through binoculars, FRUSTRATED, flare gun rea

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: (over radio) Hold! Repeat, hold!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil REVERSES towards the hole - jumps out, pulling a lin from the rear winch... EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - SUNSET Kat looks at Mahir’s boat. Nothing. She checks her watch. looks down at the tender approaching - it’s close enough can clearly see HERSELF CHATTING AND LAUGHING WITH MAX... jumps up from the daybed, holding the diver’s bag. Sator looks up at her, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I can’t do this.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: Don’t spoil this moment, Kat.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I can’t let you think you’ve won...  139. Sator looks at her, suddenly wary...

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: What are you talking about, Katherine?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m not letting you go to your grave thinking we’re all coming with you. I can’t give you that - She pulls out the SILENCED PISTOL. He is UTTERLY UNAFRAID

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're dying alone, Andrei.

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: (contemptuous ) No, I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Andrei, look in my eyes. Which do you see, despair... or anger?

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I’m not the woman who could find love for you even though you’d scarred her on the inside... Kat pulls up her shirt to reveal the MASSIVE, ANGRY SCAR

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m the vengeful bitch you scarred on the outside. Sator realizes he’s been conned - LUNGES FOR HER -

dialogues.speaker: SATOR
dialogues.text: You -! KAT SHOOTS HIM IN THE UPPER CHEST - his hands go to his c - he GASPS, air leaking from his lungs... Kat ROLLS Sator the daybed onto his back - he GURGLES - she GRABS his leg

dialogues.speaker: SLIDES HIM AT THE GAP BELOW THE RAIL -
dialogues.text: Sator SHOOTS off the deck, TUMBLING DOWN to the sea - his head CRACKS on the rear platform as he HITS the water - EXT. MAHIR’S BOAT - CONTINUOUS Mahir lowers his binoculars, STARTLED, as he sees Sator’s body pitch into the sea -  140.

dialogues.speaker: MAHIR
dialogues.text: (into radio) She’s killed him! She’s killed him! Mahir GUNS the engine, racing towards the yacht...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist opens the capsule, revealing the algorith

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: She jumped the gun - she killed him! The Protagonist looks at Ives, ashen - A LINE DROPS BETWE THEM —

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neil is at the wheel of the truck. Through the rear-view mirror he looks at his line running into the hole. Throug the windshield he watches Red and Blue soldiers finish loading and LIFT OFF. He checks his watch - ‘00:09’, ‘00:08’...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Fuck it - He GUNS it, PULLING AWAY FROM THE HOLE -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist and Ives are YANKED into the air, the Protagonist CLUTCHING the algorithm - as they approach th rocky edge of the hole, Ives raises his boots to cushion - IMPACT! They BOUNCE PAINFULLY over the lip -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The truck DRAGS them along the rocky ground, away from th hole as... BOOOOM!!!! THE ROCKY GROUND BUCKLES WITH FORCE SMOKE and FLAMES BLAST up out of the hole in an ANGRY PLU The ground around the hole COLLAPSES IN AN EVER-GROWING

dialogues.speaker: RADIUS -
dialogues.text: The line SNAPS, leaving the Protagonist and Ives TUMBLING a stop... The SUBSIDENCE approaches, SLOWING, SLOWING... ground OPENS UP under the Protagonist - Ives GRABS HIM - Protagonist has the algorithm in his hands, Ives PULLS hi back onto solid ground...  141.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wheeler PULLS a last Blue team soldier into the container her watch hits ZERO - the container door SLAMS shut -

dialogues.speaker: BLUE TEAM SOLDIER
dialogues.text: Do you think they made it? EXT. PRIVATE DECK, SATOR’S YACHT - SUNSET Kat picks up the shell casing, drops it in the diver’s ba zips it up, attaches the lanyard to her ankle, sprays dow the deck, WASHING away BLOOD and SUNSCREEN... Kat steps up to the railing. Watches Mahir, down below, getting a line on Sator’s body. Kat glances over at the TENDER ARRIVING WITH HER EARLIER SELF AND HER SON... Kat DIVES, ARCING GRACEFULLY THROUGH THE SUNSET... Kat's earlier self, stepping onto the yacht, catches a glimpse of a graceful form SLICING into the water. She lo CURIOUS, but Max TUGS her sleeve and she turns. EXT. COAST OF VIET NAM -— CONTINUOUS On Mahir’s SPEEDING boat, Kat hands Mahir the diver’s bag looks up ahead to the last light of day...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (over radio) Kat, you jumped the gun! Mahir hands her the radio -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: I couldn’t do it, I couldn’t let him die thinking he’d won. And I knew you’d find a way. Silence. She glances Mahir, suddenly concerned -

dialogues.speaker: KAT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait, you found a way? We're okay, right?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: (over radio) Yeah. We found a way. Be safe. Mahir’s boat SPEEDS AWAY through the twilight... ...DRAGGING Sator’s body behind.  142.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Chinook swirls snow around the blasted ruins... Ives an the Protagonist slump, bruised, exhausted, gas masks off, breathing hard. On the ground between them - the matte-bl algorithm... Neil approaches, removing his gas mask...

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I thought you were inverted.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Changed gears halfway - you needed help here.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: We needed help down there. (to Protagonist) How’d you get that lock open?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: It wasn’t me. (to Neil) Didn’t your team need you?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I'll get them on the next pass. Right, Ives?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Once I’ve caught my breath. The Protagonist reaches for the algorithm - Ives PULLS it of his reach - his gun laying casually across his leg. As Neil and the Protagonist watch, Ives takes his weapon in hand, gets to his feet... He lifts the algorithm... looks around at the deserted plain above Stalsk-12...

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nice and private. Ives SEPARATES the algorithm into THREE COMPONENTS -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: No one who’s seen this leaves the field...

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: We hide it, we end our lives. It’s the only way to be sure. Ives TOSSES them each one component...

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But as to when... Ives HOLSTERS his sidearm.  143.

dialogues.speaker: IVES, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s every man’s decision to make for himself.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You’re not going to kill us?

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: If I ever find you I will.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: But you won’t look too hard.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: Yes, I will. Neil shakes his head, smiling at this. Ives heads towards Chinook. Neil and the Protagonist watch him go...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: You’re not heading back to London to check on Kat, are you?

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Of course not. That would be too dangerous.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Even from afar.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Even from afar. Neil thinks of something. Looks at Ives -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Ives, wait! Neil takes his section of the algorithm, REATTACHES it to Protagonist’s.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You’re really going back in?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: I’m the only one who could’ve got that door open in time, right Ives? Ives looks at Neil, sizing him up.

dialogues.speaker: IVES
dialogues.text: I don’t have any locksmiths as good as you. Neil turns to the Protagonist, grabs his BACKPACK...  144.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: See? That's me in there, again. Weaving another pass in the fabric of this mission. Neil SWINGS his pack onto his back, revealing a TALISMAN COIN WITH A HOLE TIED to the zip WITH ORANGE AND YELLOW THREAD —

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Neil, wait.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: We just saved the world - we can’t leave anything to chance. The Protagonist thinks. Struggles.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: But can we change things? If we do it differently...? Neil looks back at the Protagonist. Sees his struggle...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: What’s happened’s happened. (smiles) Which is an expression of faith in the mechanics of the world, not an excuse to do nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Fate?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Call it what you want.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: What do you call it?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Reality. Now let me go. The Protagonist lets him walk, tears welling up... CALLS

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Hey! (Neil turns) You never did tell me who recruited you.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (smiles) Haven't you guessed by now? You did. Just not when you thought. You have a future in the past. Years ago for me. Years from now for you.  145.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: You’ve known me for years?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: (nods ) For me, I think this is the end of a beautiful friendship.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: But for me it’s just the beginning?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: And we get up to some stuff. You’re gonna love it. You’ll see. This whole operation is a temporal pincer.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Whose?

dialogues.speaker: NEIL
dialogues.text: Yours. You’re only halfway there. I’'1l see you at the beginning, friend. Neil turns. Follows Ives to board the Chinook. The Protagonist watches him go...

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We're the people saving the world from what might have been... The Protagonist looks down at the algorithm in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The world will never know what could've happened... He pulls up his collar and walks into the snow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat is walking up the road to the school gates.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--and even if they did they wouldn’t care... She feels something wrong. Looking across the road, she s a car with tinted windows shadowing her.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...because no one cares about the bomb that didn’t go off... She gets out the dumb phone the Protagonist had given her  146.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ..+.jJust the one that did...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priya is in the front passenger seat. The DRIVER next to has a GUN and SILENCER sitting on his knee...

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Do it before the boy comes out. The rear door opens - a dull thud - the Driver is SHOT by silenced pistol -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That’s your idea of mercy? Priya turns - the Protagonist has a gun to the back of he seat.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You gave me your word.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: And I told you what it would be worth. Here. Today. How did you know? He holds up a dumb phone, plays a voicemail -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: (via recording) Cannon Place, 3 o’clock, it’s -

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Posterity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kat hits send, speaks into the phone -

dialogues.speaker: KAT
dialogues.text: Cannon Place, 3 o’clock, it’s probably nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Protagonist watches Kat.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: I told you you’d have to start looking differently at the world.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: I have to tie up the loose ends.  147.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: That was never your job.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Then whose was it? The Protagonist brings his focus back to Priya.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Mine. I realized I wasn’t working for you. We’ve both been working for me... I’m the protagonist.

dialogues.speaker: PRIYA
dialogues.text: Then you’d better tie up those loose ends. He shoots her through the seat back. She slumps forward.

dialogues.speaker: PROTAGONIST
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished. The Protagonist looks across the road. The kids stream ou Kat sees Max coming, takes one last look at the dark car.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .--but it’s the bomb that didn’t go off... Kat shakes her head, smiling at her own folly, looks at t phone like it’s silly -

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...the danger no one knew was real... She tosses the phone carelessly into her bag.

dialogues.speaker: NEIL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That’s the bomb with the real power to change the world. The Protagonist watches Kat and Max walk away. Max offers his hand and we - FADE OUT. CREDITS. END.
